properties.name: Gettysburg
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27This is where the Battle of Gettysburg took place during the Civil War.Union Maj. Gen. George Gordon Meade\'s Army of the Potomac defeated attacks by Confederate General Robert E. Lee\'s Army of Northern Virginia, ending Lee\'s invasion of the North. Both armies had suffered between 46,000 and 51,000 casualties. A place called Cemetery Hill is a memorial for all the dead soldiers who died here. This is also where Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided gorge carved by the Colorado River in the U.S. state of Arizona. I\'ve been here and it\'s very dangerous yet so awesome. You can take a helicopter and go through it. There were many indian tribes around. The height of the strata is around 5,000 to 10,000 feet. When i went in the summertime it wasn\'t that hot or cold. It was mostly hot though.

properties.name: Las Vegas, Nevada
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27This place is fun and full of excitement. I visited many hotels/casinos, including Circus Circus, which had a awesome family fun center/chucky cheese style area, the Bellagio, Caesars Palace, Excalibur, The Venetian, and New York-New York, which had a rollercoaster. Security is strict here. It is really crowded also, but i liked it. We did plenty of walking and it was a big exercise. The food is good here. Check out M&M World and Adventure Dome.

properties.name: Mt. Everest
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27Mount Everest is the highest mountain on earth. There have been 210 deaths on the mountain. Isn\'t that exciting? By the end of the 2007 climbing season there had been 3,679 ascents to the summit by 2,436 individuals. Climbers range from experienced mountaineers to relative novices who count on their paid guides to get them to the top. The height of the mountain is 29,029 ft.

properties.name: Niagara Falls
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27Niagara Falls are huge waterfalls separating Ontario and New York.The falls are 17 miles (27 km) north-northwest of Buffalo, New York, 75 miles (120 km) south-southeast of Toronto, Ontario, between the twin cities of Niagara Falls, Ontario, and Niagara Falls, New York. The falls are separated into two, Horshoe Falls and American Falls. Horseshoe Falls is bigger while the American Falls is smaller. The falls attract many tourists.

properties.name: Orlando, FL
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27Orlando is an amazing city. It is home to many attractions like Disney World, Universal Studios, and Sea World. My big brother lives here. Many tourists are attracted to this city because of the attractions.Orlando has the second largest number of hotel rooms in the country, so tourists have lots of places to stay. Shoppers can shop at The Florida Mall and The Mall at Millenia.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27I chose Paris because of the Eiffel Tower. It is in iron tower in Paris, France that has become a famous structure. It is named after it\'s creator Alexander Gustavo Eiffel. Gustave Eiffel engraved on the tower seventy-two names of French scientists, engineers and other notable people. The Tower has two restaurants in it. During winter and ice rink is on the first floor. Many fires occurred at the top of the tower, and lightning has hit the top plenty of times.

properties.name: Tampa, FL
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27The Battle of Tampa took place here during the Civil War. In late 1861, the Union set up a blockade near the mouth of tampa. Union gunboats sailed up Tampa Bay to bombard Fort Brooke and the surrounding city of Tampa. The Battle of Tampa on June 30-July 1, 1862 was inconclusive, as the shells fell ineffectually and there were no casualties on either side. Tampa is another attraction holder. It is home to Busch Gardens, Adventure Island Water Park, Lowry Park Zoo, and the Florida Aquarium. Club goers can go to Ybor City or Channelside. I\'ve been here plenty of times.Shopping can be found at Westshore Plaza, University Mall and Westfield Brandon. Tampa is home to the football team Tampa Bay Buccaneers and hockey team Tampa Bay Lightning.

properties.name: Tupelo
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27THIS is where Elvis Presley was born. He was a famous rock and roll singer. Famous songs included Hound Dog and Jailhouse Rock. He was also an actor who starred in a movie called " Love Me Tender". It did well at the box office. He married Priscilla Presley and they had a daughter. On August 16, 1977 Elvis died from drug overdoes. He was 42 when the "King of Rock" died.

properties.name: Washington D.C
properties.description: Posted by Fillyjoke27This is the capital of the United States founded on July 16, 1790. It is also a site of many historic landmarks. There are many museums that feature art, space, history and many other things. This place holds many presidential memorials, too. You can find the Lincoln Memorial, Washington Memorial, Jefferson Memorial, and the FDR Memorial. The Whitehouse is located here, too.
